* BrightBlade nodded as she heard Perndabot agree to her suggestion, 
relieved that he didn�t disagree�not sure what she would do if he would 
have.
Though, his next question was a very good point, but she had a very good 
answer to go along with it.
She had not overlooked any possibility of mishaps that could occur once she 
was inside the Cybertronien Fire. Including the fact that the cloaking 
device she would use might malfunction, taking the extra precaution to take 
another one.
She took the stasis globe in her one hand but kept it close to herself, 
thinking how the beat of her own spark might keep Gangon comfortable if he 
ever began to seem detoured. Then with her other hand she reached into her 
leg compartment and retrieved the second cloaking device. It masked one�s 
signature as well as their appearance.
BrightBlade then looked back towards Perndabot and threw it towards him, 
thinking of how it wouldn�t be damaged if he managed to drop it. *

� There. No signature, no sight, no detection.�

* She then looked ahead of herself again, noting that it wouldn�t be long 
now until they reached the grasslands the base was located in.
BrightBlade looked down at Gangon�s spark as it beat inside the transparent 
ball; careful to carry it so that it wouldn�t get all bumped about. *
